meanings.definition: Attractive or appealing in a romantic or sexual way.
meanings.sent1: The movie star was so fanciable that everyone in the audience admired them.
meanings.sent2: She felt flattered when her crush called her fanciable.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics made it even more fanciable to the family.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a fanciable array of colors.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a fanciable paradise of blooming flowers and buzzing bees.

meanings.definition: Able to be fancied or desired.
meanings.sent1: The new car model was so fanciable that many people wanted to buy it.
meanings.sent2: The shiny jewelry in the store window looked very fanciable.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pizza party seemed fanciable to the hungry group of friends.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were filled with fanciable possibilities of adventure and success.
meanings.sent5: The blank canvas held endless fanciable potential for the artist's creativity.
